title: Integrate official TrueVision Digital Agency logo across header/footer branding

requirements.summary: Add official TrueVision logo static assets and centralize logo references in site configuration for consistent use across the site.
acceptanceCriteria: New logo assets exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are optimized for web use (reasonable file size, crisp edges).
frontend/src/config/site.ts exposes logo asset path(s) and alt text (e.g., full brand name) so components do not hardcode logo filenames.
No page loads the previously hardcoded /assets/generated/truevision-logo-mark.dim_512x512.png unless explicitly kept as a fallback.

file_operations.description: Add the official horizontal lockup logo PNG (transparent background), optimized for web use.
Add the official square mark/icon logo PNG (transparent background), optimized for web use.
Add a high-contrast horizontal lockup logo PNG variant for very dark backgrounds (transparent background), optimized for web use.

Expose centrally-configured branding logo fields (paths for mark/lockup + dark variant as needed, plus consistent alt text such as "TrueVision Digital Agency") so UI components do not hardcode filenames.

requirements.summary: Update the Navbar branding to use the official centrally-configured logo with responsive alignment and good contrast on the dark + neon theme.
acceptanceCriteria: Navbar renders the official logo in the left brand area (or top-center on narrow layouts if implemented), linking to the Home route.
Logo is clearly visible against the dark header (no low-contrast blending) and remains sharp at typical sizes (e.g., ~32–40px height).
Branding does not break the existing navbar layout across common breakpoints (mobile menu, tablet, desktop).

file_operations.description: Create a reusable brand logo component that reads logo paths + alt text from frontend/src/config/site.ts and supports size/variant props to ensure consistent branding usage across the app.

Replace the hardcoded logo with the reusable BrandLogo component, sourcing logo paths + alt text from frontend/src/config/site.ts; ensure responsive sizing/alignment and adequate visibility against the sticky dark header. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update the Footer branding block to use the official centrally-configured logo with aligned brand text and consistent dark + neon styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer brand section renders the official logo with an appropriate size (e.g., ~40–48px height) and aligned with the brand name text.
Logo remains clearly visible on the footer background and does not appear washed out or too dim.
Footer continues to render without layout shift or overflow on small screens.

file_operations.description: Replace the hardcoded logo with the reusable BrandLogo component, sourcing logo paths + alt text from frontend/src/config/site.ts; tune sizing/alignment for the footer brand block and ensure dark-background contrast. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Replace any other hardcoded/placeholder branding logo usages to use the centrally-configured official logo assets for consistency site-wide.
acceptanceCriteria: A search for the previous logo path (/assets/generated/truevision-logo-mark.dim_512x512.png) shows no remaining usage outside any explicit fallback logic.
All branding logo placements (including header/footer) reference the centralized values from frontend/src/config/site.ts.
All logo elements use appropriate alt text that includes the full brand name (e.g., "TrueVision Digital Agency").

file_operations.description: Ensure the BrandLogo component standardizes alt text from frontend/src/config/site.ts and is flexible enough to replace remaining branding logo placements without reintroducing hardcoded asset paths.
Audit layout-level branding usage and ensure any branding render points (if present now or added later) consume the centrally-configured BrandLogo rather than hardcoded logo asset paths.
